TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1728
TEI.2.document_title: John Hinkson to Stephen F. Austin, 12-01-1827

document_location.sent_from: Austin's Colony, District of Colorado, Texas

barker_notes.barker_summary: John Hinkson to Austin, December 1, 1827. Land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1728

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*John Hinkson to Austin, December 1, 1827. Land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="12-01-1827">December the 1*/date_mentioned*—*location_mentioned*Austins Colony*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1827">1827*/date_mentioned*—*location_mentioned*District of Colorado*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir in Consequence of your absence and the *person_mentioned*Commissiners*/person_mentioned* I have Bin unable to procure my Land and my Business Compells me to go to *location_mentioned*new Orleans*/location_mentioned* Before your Return and if you will confer the Favour on me to Reserve my land untill the *date_mentioned n="07-2o-1828">twentieth of July next*/date_mentioned* I will Return By that time and make you promp payment *person_mentioned*Mr Rosin Aalley*/person_mentioned* will survey it and make Return thereof to you if you will grant the above mentioned favour it will forever Be Acknowledged By me I am yours with Respect—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Hinkson*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
